org.corfudb.runtime.smr

Interface ISMREngine<T>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IBufferedSMREngine<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BufferedSMREngine, CachedSMREngine, OneShotSMREngine, PassThroughSMREngine, SimpleSMREngine, TimeTravelSMREngine

    public interface ISMREngine<T>
    An interface to an SMR engine Created by mwei on 5/1/15.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ISMREngine.ISMREngineOptions<T>

      Set the underlying object.
      <R> void sync(ITimestamp ts)
      Synchronize the SMR engine to a given timestamp, or pass null to synchronize the SMR engine as far as possible.

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        T getObject()
        Get the underlying object. The object is dynamically created by the SMR engine.
        Returns:
        The object maintained by the SMR engine.

      • setObject

        void setObject(T object)
        Set the underlying object. This method should ONLY be used by a TX engine to restore state.

      • sync

        <R> void sync(ITimestamp ts)
        Synchronize the SMR engine to a given timestamp, or pass null to synchronize the SMR engine as far as possible.
        Parameters:
        ts - The timestamp to synchronize to, or null, to synchronize to the most recent version.

      • read

        default <R> R read(ISMREngineCommand<T,R> command)
        Execute a read only command against this engine.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The return type of the command.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to execute. It must be read only.
        Returns:
        The return value.

      • propose

        <R> ITimestamp propose(ISMREngineCommand<T,R> command,
                       CompletableFuture<R> completion,
                       boolean readOnly)
        Propose a new command to the SMR engine.
        Parameters:
        command - A lambda (BiConsumer) representing the command to be proposed. The first argument of the lambda is the object the engine is acting on. The second argument of the lambda contains some TX that the engine
        completion - A completable future which will be fulfilled once the command is proposed, which is to be completed by the command.
        readOnly - Whether or not the command is read only.
        Returns:
        A timestamp representing the timestamp that the command was proposed to.

      • propose

        default <R> ITimestamp propose(ISMREngineCommand<T,R> command,
                               CompletableFuture<R> completion)
        Propose a new command to the SMR engine.
        Parameters:
        command - A lambda (BiConsumer) representing the command to be proposed. The first argument of the lambda is the object the engine is acting on. The second argument of the lambda contains some TX that the engine
        completion - A completable future which will be fulfilled once the command is proposed, which is to be completed by the command.
        Returns:
        A timestamp representing the timestamp that the command was proposed to.

      • propose

        default <R> ITimestamp propose(ISMREngineCommand<T,R> command)
        Propose a new command to the SMR engine. This convenience function allows you to pass the command without the completable future.
        Parameters:
        command - A lambda (BiConsumer) representing the command to be proposed. The first argument of the lambda is the object the engine is acting on. The second argument of the lambda contains some TX that the engine
        Returns:
        A timestamp representing the timestamp the command was proposed to.

      • propose

        default <R> ITimestamp propose(ISMREngineCommand<T,R> command,
                               boolean writeOnly)

      • propose

        default <R> ITimestamp propose(ISMRLocalCommand<T,R> command,
                               CompletableFuture<R> completion,
                               boolean readOnly)
        Propose a local command to the SMR engine. A local command is one which is executed locally only, but may propose other commands which affect multiple objects.
        Parameters:
        command - A lambda representing the command to be proposed
        completion - A completion to be fulfilled.
        readOnly - True, if the command is read only, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        A timestamp representing the command proposal time.

      • propose

        default <R> ITimestamp propose(ISMRLocalCommand<T,R> command,
                               CompletableFuture<R> completion)
        Propose a local command to the SMR engine. A local command is one which is executed locally only, but may propose other commands which affect multiple objects.
        Parameters:
        command - A lambda representing the command to be proposed.
        completion - A completion to be fulfilled.
        Returns:
        A timestamp representing the command proposal time.

      • checkpoint

        ITimestamp checkpoint()
               throws IOException
        Checkpoint the current state of the SMR engine.
        Returns:
        The timestamp the checkpoint was inserted at.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getLastProposal

        ITimestamp getLastProposal()
        Get the timestamp of the most recently proposed command.
        Returns:
        A timestamp representing the most recently proposed command.

      • check

        ITimestamp check()
        Pass through to check for the underlying stream.
        Returns:
        A timestamp representing the most recently proposed command on a stream.

      • getStreamID

        UUID getStreamID()
        Get the underlying stream ID.
        Returns:
        A UUID representing the ID for the underlying stream.

      • getInstance

        default ICorfuDBInstance getInstance()
        Get the CorfuDB instance that supports this SMR engine.
        Returns:
        A CorfuDB instance.

      • getStreamPointer

        default ITimestamp getStreamPointer()
        Get the timestamp of the entry the state machine most recently applied.
        Returns:
        The timestamp of the most recently synced entry.
